reviews.review_msg: I'm REALLY BAD at math/quantitative thinking. If you're like me, you'll likely struggle in his class. Firstly, his pace is pretty fast. He's a take-no-bs kinda prof but it makes him extremely unapproachable. He also doesn't give in-depth answers to your questions which is frustrating. I highly recommend making a friend or two for extra help.

This was my first class with Chris and I thought it was fantastic. He is very knowledgeable of the course content and I really liked how he was able to link the work we were doing with opportunities outside of continuing within Academia. Chris provided a lot of feedback on assignments and was very approachable. Fabulous learning experience.

He certainly knows what he is doing in his major but his teaching is really vague. There were times when I did what he instructed in our assignments and got my marks deducted for doing what he asked us to do. There were also times when I tried to use his example of parts of assignments just to receive a feedback saying that what I did is incorrect.

Chris has a lot of experience in research, but he doesn't seem very enthusiastic about teaching it to others. Assignments were not explained properly and notes were sometimes uploaded a week late. He's also not very approachable so you're on your own if you take this course.

Chris was my favourite prof (I'm 4th year). He is a real person and hilarious. He gives what you put in. Lazy? Good luck. This class was a lot of work but you actually learn something (it was practical). Just like you wouldn't ask a prof to summarize your reading for you, don't expect him to do your work - which is why he may seem short with some.

Chris was very helpful and I appreciated his sense of humour. With that said, be sure to pay attention to lectures... if you do not, then do not expect him to give you all the answers. If you show you care, he will too. This class was the most practical class I have taken in my sociology degree thus far!

Chris is a wonderful prof and great person overall. Sense of humour, really cares about the subject (and knows a lot about it), and gives great feedback to help you success in the course and more importantly, beyond it.  Thanks Chris :)

Chris is the best professor I've had at SFU. That being said, his classes are not easy, but he is there to help you. It is possible to get a good grade in his class, but you will have to put work into it. He is an amazing prof and truly cares for his students if they are willing to work hard.

Chris is the best instructor I've had at SFU. Heavy work load requiring a good amount of time and thought, but it's well worth the investment to learn some applicable research skills. Chris is extremely helpful and wants students to do well - gives great feedback and is available for extra help. Would take another class with him in a heartbeat.
One of the very few profs who cares about students and who actually wants us to learn something useful.

I had high hopes for Chris, considering this class covers such dry material and I was hoping he could make it better. However, he is quite full of himself and talks about his accomplishments more than necessary. He is also a difficult marker and not the friendliest in emails. Only take this class if it is required for your major.
He is kind of terrible actually. Gives a lot of feedback, but his assignments are hard and he isn't really as funny as he thinks he is.

Cool guy - very funny. I had him as my TA too and tutorials were so useless. His lectures were useful and he is very knowledgeable. I wouldn't say that he is a hard marker. He's a very fair marker that gives a lot of feedback. If you make an impression on him he'll remember your name. Get read for a lot of work!

Chris is a very good teacher. Kind of arrogant, the occasional bizarre joke but who cares? That just makes the interesting. He's a hard marker but he gives so much feedback that your grades shouldn't suffer so long as you heed his advice. Tests are easy! Would take another class with him in a flash!

I read some of the less flattering comments on here before I took the course but I have to say, I actually enjoyed the way Chris lectured and looked forward in coming to class. His sarcasm and sense of humor is my kind of stuff. This guy also provides tons of feedback because he wants you to do well. Big plus that he also understands technology.
Best prof! Heavy course load but very informative and interesting.

Yes, he has a somewhat abrasive, irreverent personality. However, he is also quite funny. I generally can't stand arrogant people, so I was wary of taking this class with him after reading these comments, but I greatly enjoyed the experience. He provides tons of feedback on assignments, and he is quite easy to talk to in his office hours.

Chris shows that he is very passionate about students bettering social research skills. He gives detailed feedback on assignments. He is also very approachable during office hrs. More importantly, his lectures & text don't sugar coat the realities of obstacles you may encounter in research.

Chris gives tons of feedback and is a fair marker. People say he is tough and rude but hey, get over it. You are in University. Life is tough. If you want to learn things take his class. Very well structured and the amount of feedback he gives makes getting a good grade very realistic.

Class is valuable, so is the textbook. Teacher on the other hand ... in love with himself. Employs "edgy"  teaching style (with lectures full of "edgy" naughty words, punctuated by "ughs" and "ahhs") devoid of substance. Got good grade in class, yet still got strange email deriding my efforts. Strange stuff. Strange teacher. Highly over-rated.

Probably one of the best profs I have ever had. Yes the class is hard, yes you have to do TONS of work...but it definately was the most informative, interesting class I've ever taken. Make use of his office hours, he is EXTREMELY helpful and wants you to do well. If you cant deal with dry sarcasm though, stay away. But overall, hes an amazing prof

This class was extremely valuable for anyone interested in research. Chris covers a lot of ground, and keeps the class engaged in lectures. He actually asks his students more questions than we ask him, which helps in retaining information. On the downside, this course requires A LOT of work, do not take it in a heavy courseload.
no comment
Difficult courseload but amazing prof. Except- he is so damn cute its hard to concentrate on what he's trying to teach!

Difficult class. I would recommend going to lecture and reading the text. There are a lot of terms to remember for the midterm which was overwelming but by the end of the course the terms were easier to understand and the final was easier b/c of the assignments. Don't let his first lecture scare you, he seems less "standoffish" later on.
The most useful class I have taken so far. Hella lot of work but not overly hard. Great instructor, very passionate about research and teaching. Lectures were worth going to.

I have never had a prof that provided as much constructive feedback on my work as this guy. He seems passionate about what he teaches and he really seems to care about his students. THIS CLASS IS HARD but the lectures are informative and entertaining and the support that the prof provides is outstanding if you take advantage of it.
interesting lectures. funny and opinionated dude. hard marker. fast response time to emails, but doesn't give straight answers. definitely not an easy class.

A really helpful prof and in general I did really like his class. While I did appreciate how much he disliked big, pretentious words, I did find his constantly referring to himself as an anarchist to be a bit much. All in all though a tough and worthwhile course!

I remember this guy. I was not impressed with his demeanor during instruction. He did not provide students with the dignity required to perform at their optimum. And I remember his words before our course evaluations ?You?re fooling yourself if you think that I won?t recognize your handwriting? Unethical.Unusual. unsophisticated.

The concepts discussed in class are very clearly presented both in lecture and the textbook. The assignments were so useful for completing the final project. Not a huge fan of multiple choice exams, but not bad. Chris is approachable and kind. Takes a real interest in the work students are doing, if they exhibit they are interested in the class.

i dont like this guy. he is such a big jerk. he chats with the tas when the class is doing midterm. totally disrespect to the whole class. i dont really care if he reads this. i think he should change his arrogant attitude. he thinks he is top of the world. what a shame!
really entertaining and realistic

Chris is great - if you pay attention and try hard he is happy to help you either by email or in person.  He seems to want everyone to do well, and is the most attentive prof I've ever had.  Thanks Chris!  You rock!

I'm soo surprised he has good reviews he is a hard maker and difficult to understand and not the best teacher, actually he sucks and the fact that he read this site is sad and he and his friends probably wrote all the good reviews hands down he is a means cold hearted teacher ....the truth :[

all i have to say is, chris reads this site and so does his friends, so: hi chris & his friends.  with that being said. chris is a good prof, and like the others said, it shows that he wants his students to succeed. puts in a lot of his own free time to help students, etc.
Great Teacher. Articulate, fair, and actually wants students to succeed.  He is also very willing to answer questions (email & after class). I would take a class with him again.

Cuts thru the **** quickly, very techno-saavy, puts course notes on-line after each class, assignments submitted on-line, evaluations of assignments delivered on-line.  All-in-all, more prof's could/should copy his teaching methods.  He is very good at using the computer in various supportive capacities.  Would take a course from him again.
Hands down, the best. Tough, fair and funny
No Comments
No Comments

Great Prof.  Friendly and helpful if you take advantage of office hours and email.  Tons of experience and knows his stuff.  He is also young and in touch with the role of technology in social research.  Be warned, 255 is a heavy course with a huge project (20-50pg) and lots of assingments that take a lot of effort.  Hard work pays off though!

At first, I found him to be a very engaging and passionate speaker. But as the course went on, I found him to be quite arrogant and repetitive. To his credit, he is knowledgeable and has plenty of experience. He is a 'to the point' kind of guy which comes off as blunt and insensitive.

Great Prof! Basically, what you work for is what you get. This course definately requires a lot of work but not hard to do good in. Exams are fair. Very passionate about his work. Makes a dull course interesting. Gives out a lot of feedback. If you ask for help he will give it.
Chris is a totaly awesome prof and human being. It is true he will make you work hard but he will match the level of effort that you put into the class. And yes he is totally hot!

Chris is a phenomenal person and prof. You'll never meet another person like him. His insights and point of views in life are awe-inspiring and life changing.  Any Quantitative methods class is gonna be hard..but Chris definatley teaches the course well.

GREAT prof.  Good sense of humor, great dedication, and totally fair.  Chris makes serious efforts to help and be available to students.  Gotta do the work cause the course isn't easy but Chris makes the dry content seem interesting...love the rants!

Chris is a super caring prof, that will help you when needed. A fair marker and puts alot of effort into giving feedback.  The class itself is very difficult, but he tries his best to assist you.  If you want to learn something take this class, if you're looking for an easy A, don't count on it!

gives heavy workload BUT is very helpful at the same time! Shows a an incredible amount of passion in the course and TRULY cares about his students....his sarcastic humor adds much flavor to the boring-nature class:)

this course will be hard no matter WHO teaches it cuz it IS a research methods course. so material=HARD. but CHRIS= AWESOME PROF!! i love his little jokes inbetween lectures and he's so organized and helpfull. chris is the ideal prof:clear & not only helpfull, but ALWAYS available! he's also cute ;)
I was dreading taking this (required) class but Chris' passion makes it interesting. It is quite challenging but he and his TAs are VERY approachable.
No Comments

There are no surprises. he's clear, explains exactly what is expected in each assigment or exam, always willing to answer questions, and highly recommends that you do (if you want to succeed)! and although its a req'd course that seems dry, chris makes it tolerable.
